entry.headline: Marks & Spencer Signs Deal With IBM and SAP
entry.body: LONDON, Jan 27 (MARKET WIRE) -- IBM (NYSE: IBM) and SAP (NYSE: SAP) today announced an agreement with Marks & Spencer (M) to implement a suite of SAP Retail applications. The programme aims to provide M with accurate business data and robust core processes to enable business improvement initiatives in cost and operating efficiencies. Specifically, the programme will improve stock visibility and management of information, while increasing process efficiency which M believes will enhance the customer experience and drive greater control over net margin. Marks & Spencer Director of IT & Logistics, Darrell Stein, says: "We selected IBM and SAP after an extensive assessment of the market. In addition to strong retail credentials, we felt there was also a strong cultural alignment. In order to provide the very best customer service, we need to be flexible and agile to their changing needs. The SAP solution, implemented by IBM, will allow us to do that." Protecting the environment is also considered by the IBM programme, and recommendations have been provided to ensure all aspects are aligned with 'Plan A,' M' 100-point eco plan. For example, the increased accuracy of business data will help M monitor and report its environmentally friendly activities. "IBM is committed to helping retailers deliver smarter solutions which drive operational excellence, demand-driven merchandising and supply chain processes," said Simon Rabone, Associate Partner, Retail, IBM Global Business Services. "IBM's retail expertise and ongoing relationship with M will help the retailer develop new innovative ways to add value to their business and drive down operational costs." IBM will draw on its organisation, process and technology expertise to provide end-to-end programme management, including change management and business process consulting services. SAP will provide its leading Industry Solution for Retail, a suite of business applications designed specifically to meet the unique requirements of large and sophisticated retailers. "As retailers strive to grow their businesses, many are looking towards international expansion and extending into new retail formats. The execution of these strategies needs to be underpinned by adaptable solutions that can drive out the anticipated benefits. SAP has a proven track record in food, convenience and general merchandise retailing and we are delighted that M has joined the growing list of retailers that are selecting SAP to support their growth ambitions," said Tom Fischer, Retail Divisional Manager, SAP UK & Ireland. About IBM For more information on IBM please visit -- www.ibm.com/retail. About SAP SAP is the world's leading provider of business software(*), offering applications and services that enable companies of all sizes and in more than 25 industries to become best-run businesses. With approximately 76,000 customers (includes customers from the acquisition of Business Objects) in over 120 countries, the company is listed on several exchanges, including the Frankfurt stock exchange and NYSE, under the symbol "SAP." (For more information, visit www.sap.com). (*) SAP defines business software as comprising enterprise resource planning and related applications. Any statements contained in this document that are not historical facts are forward-looking statements as defined in the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Words such as "anticipate," "believe," "estimate," "expect," "forecast," "intend," "may," "plan," "project," "predict," "should" and "will" and similar expressions as they relate to SAP are intended to identify such forward-looking statements. SAP undertakes no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements. All forward-looking statements are subject to various risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from expectations. The factors that could affect SAP's future financial results are discussed more fully in SAP's filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC"), including SAP's most recent Annual Report on Form 20-F filed with the SEC. Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which speak only as of their dates. Copyright Copyright 2008 SAP AG. All rights reserved. SAP, R/3, mySAP, mySAP.com, xApps, xApp, SAP NetWeaver and other SAP products and services mentioned herein as well as their respective logos are trademarks or registered trademarks of SAP AG in Germany and in several other countries all over the world. All other product and service names mentioned are the trademarks of their respective companies. Data contained in this document serve informational purposes only. National product specifications may vary. For more information: Lucy Chapman External Relations - IBM UK Communications +44 (0) 20 7021 8911 LUCYCHAPMAN@uk.ibm.com Molly McDonagh PR Manager, SAP UK +44 (0)7966 975 287 Molly.mcdonagh@sap.com Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Panorama Offers Dedicated BI Option To Microsoft PerformancePoint Server And Proclarity Customers Affected By Discontinuation Announcement
entry.body: Panorama, Maker of NovaView® BI, is Committed to Long-Term Enterprise BI Development; January 29 Webinar Event to Explain Migration Option to PPS and Proclarity Users TORONTO--(Business Wire)-- Panorama Software, a global leader in proactive Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and the company that sold its OLAP technology to Microsoft, announced today that its flagship BI product, NovaView®, is immediately available as a reliable, long-term BI solution for Microsoft PerformancePoint Server and Proclarity customers adversely affected by Microsoft`s recent discontinuation announcement. Panorama NovaView is a comprehensive BI solution designed for the Microsoft SQL Server BI Platform. It includes virtually all features of the PerformancePoint Server BI dashboard, analytics and monitoring in a fully Web-based or desktop client. NovaView is available in both On-premise and SaaS versions. To ensure a seamless changeover for interested customers, Panorama is offering a migration path to NovaView, including the company`s offsite SaaS product. Panorama has set a special Webinar event on January 29, 2009, to answer questions and explain alternatives for Microsoft PerformancePoint Server customers. Register at: http://www.panorama.com/webcasts/archives/2009/microsoft-alternative-business-intelligence-jan-2009.html. On January 23, Microsoft announced that it will discontinue offering standalone versions of PerformancePoint Server, its integrated performance management product. As part of that announcement Microsoft announced it will also stop selling the Proclarity Pro product which will have no future versions. When that occurs, there will no longer a dedicated Business Intelligence product; instead, Microsoft will simply offer BI as a set of services among others in Microsoft Office and SharePoint. "Panorama is a BI company, one that has invested heavily in providing the best BI solution for the Microsoft BI platform," said Oudi Antebi, Vice President of Marketing and Strategy for Panorama Software. "We believe companies deserve a Business Intelligence solution that is supported by someone completely dedicated to its development and success, rather than something that is a small portion of a larger business solution. Panorama was, is, and will be the best overall solution for customers who choose the Microsoft SQL Server platform for BI." With Microsoft`s shift to providing BI within Office and SharePoint, users will be able to accomplish a limited range of analysis and scorecarding. However, Panorama intends to aggressively pursue its strategy of offering full enterprise BI functionality in a single, complete and integrated suite that surpasses the basic capabilities to be found in Office or SharePoint, and with a greater pace of innovation. Panorama is offering a special promotion for Proclarity customers looking to migrate to Panorama NovaView. Details can be received by emailing to proclarity@Panorama.com. The company is also providing complete technical assistance to enterprise users wishing to migrate to its NovaView Server platform. To register for the January 29th Q webinar, log on to www.panorama.com/webinar_schedule.html; to learn more about Panorama`s suite of dedicated NovaView BI solutions, go to www.panorama.com. About Panorama Software: Panorama Software empowers individuals and global organizations with the ability to rapidly analyze data, identify trends, maximize business opportunities and improve corporate performance and results through a complete SaaS and on-premise BI solution. Panorama NovaView®, the company`s flagship solution, amplifies the impact of the information worker through a tightly integrated and complete suite of `on-premise` analysis, reporting, scorecard, dashboard and data modeling applications that support the twoleading data platforms, SAP (NYSE: SAP) and Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT). Panorama`s solution for Google Apps empowers individuals and enterprises with the most intuitive and accessible SaaS-based BI solution. Founded in 1993, Panorama is a leading innovator in Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) and Multidimensional Expressions (MDX). Panorama sold its OLAP technology to Microsoft Corporation in 1996; the technology was rebranded as SQL ServerTM Analysis Services and integrated into the SQL ServerTM platform.Panorama supports over 1,000 customers worldwide in industries such as financial services, manufacturing, retail, healthcare, telecommunications and life sciences.Panorama has a wide eco-system of partners in 30 countries, and maintains offices throughout North America, EMEA and Asia. More information is available at www.panorama.com. NovaView and the Panorama logo are trademarks or registered trademarks of Panorama Software Ltd. All other company product or brand names are the trademarks or the registered trademarks of their respective companies. Panorama Software Ltd. is not responsible for errors or omissions. Copyright 2009 Panorama Software Ltd. All rights reserved. Press Contact: SS|PR Belinda Banks, 609-750-9110 belinda@sspr.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs ogłasza pojawienie się pierwszych absolwentek programu "10 000 Kobiet" w Indiach
entry.body: - Większy udział kobiet w sile roboczej Indii - Możliwość zwiększenia rzeczywistych wskaźników wzrostu PKB o 1,0% - PKB w przeliczeniu na osobę może się zwiększyć nawet do 10% HYDERABAD, Indie--(Business Wire)-- Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) spotkała się dziś ze studentami Indyjskiej Szkoły Biznesu (ISB), aby uczcić ukończenie kursu przez pierwsze kobiety w ramach inicjatywy "10 000 Kobiet" w Indiach. "10 000 Kobiet" to światowe przedsięwzięcie zapewniające wykształcenie z zakresu biznesu i zarządzania dyskryminowanym kobietom, głównie mieszkającym na obszarach rozwijających się lub wschodzących rynków. Absolwentki spotkały się z liderami z Goldman Sachs, ISB i przedstawiły biznes plany, które opracowały w czasie studiów z zamiarem rozwoju ich istniejących już firm. Pierwsza grupa 29 absolwentek rozpoczęła zajęcia w październiku. Absolwentki ukończyły 150-godzinny program z zakresu przedsiębiorczości, który obejmował trwające trzy tygodnie zajęcia na uczelni i dziewięciotygodniowy mentoring oraz pomoc w wykonywaniu poszczególnych zadań. Końcowym celem zajęć była pomoc kobietom w rozwijaniu ich działalności biznesowej od początkujących firm do rozrastających się i stabilnych przedsiębiorstw. Druga grupa kobiet rozpocznie naukę w Bangalore w lutym. Łącznie 300 hinduskich kobiet odbędzie szkolenie w tym pięcioletnim programie. "Absolwentki programu "10 000 Kobiet" to doskonały przykład niemal nieograniczonego potencjału indyjskiej gospodarki - powiedziała Brooks Entwistle, dyrektor zarządzający i dyrektor generalny Goldman Sachs w Indiach. - Badania wykazały, że inwestycje w edukację biznesową, takie jak ta, mogą mieć ogromny wpływ na rozwijające się rynki lokalne oraz standardy życia". Inicjatywa "10 000 Kobiet" została opracowana w oparciu o badania przeprowadzone przez Bank Światowy, Goldman Sachs i inne organizacje, które uważają edukację kobiet za jeden z najbardziej efektywnych sposobów na zwiększenie wzrostu gospodarczego oraz polepszenie standardów życia w przypadku rozwijających się gospodarek. Z badań wynika, że średnio jednoprocentowy wzrost w edukacji kobiet zwiększa roczne wskaźniki wzrostu PKB o 0.2 punktu procentowego. Analiza "Kobiety podtrzymują połowę nieba" opublikowana przez Badania Gospodarcze Goldman Sachs, wykazała, że zwiększenie liczby kobiet w sile roboczej, będące naturalną konsekwencją lepszej edukacji, może dodać 1% do rocznego wskaźnika wzrostu PKB Indii oraz może zwiększyć PKB w przeliczeniu na osobę o 10% w przeciągu dekady. Program nauczania ISB oferuje studentom zajęcia na uczelni, mentoring, pracę w sieci oraz analizy przypadków udanych przedsiębiorstw z całego świata. W końcowej fazie programu studenci współzawodniczyli w prezentacji biznes planów, które stworzyli w celu rozwoju ich biznesów. Inicjatywa Goldman Sachs "10 000 Kobiet" została uruchomiona 5 marca 2008 r. W ciągu pięciu następnych lat przeznaczy ona 100 mln USD, współpracowała również z ponad 50 uniwersytetami i organizacjami w Afryce, Azji, Europie, Ameryce Łacińskiej, Bliskim Wschodzie oraz Stanach Zjednoczonych w celu odnalezienia, stworzenia i rozwijania programów wpływających na jakość i możliwości edukacji biznesowej w rozwijających się regionach na całym świecie. Więcej informacji o programie "10 000 Kobiet" znajduje się na stronie http://www.10000women.org. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. jest spółką bankową i wiodącą na świecie firmą, zajmującą się bankowością inwestycyjną, zabezpieczeniami i zarządzaniem inwestycyjnym. Goldman Sachs oferuje szeroką gamę usług na całym świecie dla znacznej i zróżnicowanej bazy klientów, która obejmuje korporacje, instytucje finansowe, rządy oraz jednostki o wysokiej wartości netto. Firma została założona w 1869 roku, ma swoją siedzibę w Nowym Jorku oraz posiada biura w Londynie, Frankfurcie, Tokio, Hong Kongu i innych głównych centrach finansowych na całym świecie. Oficjalną, obowiązującą wersję niniejszego zawiadomienia stanowi tekst oryginalny sporządzony w języku źródłowym. Tekst tłumaczenia służy wyłącznie celom orientacyjnym/sporządzono wyłącznie dla celów ułatwienia zrozumienia zawiadomienia i należy interpretować go w odniesieniu do tekstu źródłowego, który jest jedyną wersją mającą skutki prawne. Edward Naylor tel. +852-2978-0212 Joe Snodgrass tel. +1 212-902-5400 Inwestorzy: Dane Holmes tel. 212-902-03580 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs anuncia a primeira graduação na Índia de 10.000 Mulheres
entry.body: Maior participação das mulheres na força de trabalho da Índia Pode aumentar as taxas de crescimento do PIB em 1.0%; O PIB per capita pode aumentar em até 10% HYDERABAD, India--(Business Wire)-- A The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) se juntou hoje a estudantes na Indian School of Business (ISB) para marcar a graduação das primeiras estudantes na iniciativa 10.000 Mulheres na Índia. 10.000 Mulheres é um esforço global que fornece educação de negócios e administração para mulheres carentes, predominantemente em mercados em desenvolvimento e emergentes. As estudantes graduadas se encontraram com líderes da Goldman Sachs, ISB, e apresentaram planos de negócios desenvolvidos durante o curso, e com vistas a expandir seus negócios existentes. A primeira classe graduada de 29 mulheres começou o curso em outubro. As diplomadas concluíram um programa com certificado de 150 horas sobre empreendedorismo que incluiu três semanas de instrução em sala de aula e nove semanas de aconselhamento e suporte no trabalho. A meta final do curso foi ajudar as mulheres a expandir seus negócios desde o desenvolvimento, criando empresas em crescimento e sustentáveis. Um segundo grupo de mulheres vai iniciar seus estudos em Bangalore em fevereiro. Um total de 300 mulheres indianas vai receber treinamento durante o programa de cinco anos. "Estas graduadas do 10.000 Mulheres são um exemplo excelente do potencial praticamente ilimitado da economia indiana", disse Brooks Entwistle, diretor gerente e diretor executivo da Goldman Sachs India. "Pesquisas têm demonstrado que investimentos feitos em educação empresarial como esta têm um drástico e positivo efeito multiplicador tanto na economia local quanto nos padrões de vida". A iniciativa 10.000 Mulheres foi fundada com base em pesquisa realizada pelo Banco Mundial, Goldman Sachs, e outros, que constatou que mulheres com formação é uma das maneiras mais eficazes de aumentar o crescimento econômico e melhorar os padrões de vida em economias em desenvolvimento. Estudos concluíram que, em média, 1% de aumento na educação feminina aumenta as taxas de crescimento do PIB anual em 0.2 por cento. "Women Hold Up Half the Sky" (As mulheres suportam metade dos céus), uma análise publicada pela Goldman Sachs Economic Research, constatou que ao aumentar o número de mulheres na força de trabalho, que é um resultado natural de mais educação, seria possível adicionar 1% às taxas de crescimento do PIB anual da Índia e aumentar o PIB per capita em 10% em uma década. O currículo do programa da ISB oferece às estudantes instrução em sala de aula, aconselhamento, rede de contatos, e estudos de caso de empresas bem sucedidas em todo o mundo. Na fase final do programa, as estudantes participam em uma apresentação de planos de negócios desenhado para expandir seus próprios negócios. A iniciativa 10.000 Mulheres da Goldman Sachs foi lançada em 5 de março de 2008. Vai entregar US$100 milhões durante os próximos cinco anos e tem parceria com mais de 50 universidades e organizações em África, Ásia, Europa, América Latina, Oriente Médio e nos EUA para buscar, criar e desenvolver programas para impactar a qualidade e capacidade de educação empresarial em regiões em desenvolvimento em todo o mundo. Para obter informações adicionais sobre o programa 10.000 Mulheres, visite www.10000women.org. A Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., é uma empresa central bancária, e uma empresa líder global em negócios bancários de investimento, administração de títulos e de investimentos. A Goldman Sachs fornece uma ampla variedade de serviços em todo o mundo para uma base de clientes substancial e diversificada que inclui corporações, instituições financeiras, governos e indivíduos de alta renda líquida. Fundada em 1869, a empresa está sediada em Nova York e mantém escritórios em Londres, Frankfurt, Tóquio, Hong Kong e outros importantes centros financeiros em todo o mundo. O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. As traduções são fornecidas apenas como uma facilidade e devem se referir ao texto no idioma original, que é a única versão do texto que tem efeito legal. The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. entry.author: None
entry.headline: ImpreMedia to Market Televisa`s Content for Mobile Devices in the US Market Under Partnership With globefish
entry.body: New Mobile and Online Service Tailored to Growing US Hispanic Market NEW YORK, N.Y.--(Business Wire)-- ImpreMedia, the No. 1 Hispanic News and Information Company in the U.S. in Online and Print, announced today that it will market Televisa`s mobile content to the Hispanic community in the U.S. through a partnership with globefish, an innovative solutions provider in digital and mobile content distribution and advertising. ImpreMedia will now provide popular mobile content to the US Hispanic market from Televisa, the largest media company in the Spanish-speaking world. The mobile offering will include ringtones, wallpapers, music, games and other downloads from Televisa`s highly popular television and music programming and celebrities ranging in cost from $0.99 to $4.99. This content will be marketed and promoted to the U.S. Hispanic market through impreMedia`s award winning publications and new online portal, impre.com (http://www.impre.com) for direct download to the mobile handset. Approximately 71% of English-speaking Hispanics consume mobile content in the U.S., making them among the most active and engaged mobile-content consumers, according to M:Metrics, citing a general market average of 48%. "It`s our goal to serve the US Hispanic community," said Arturo Duran, CEO of impreMedia Digital. "Together with Televisa and globefish, we will now be able to bring Latino`s of all ages the best of Hispanic entertainment, directly to their most personal device - the mobile phone." ImpreMedia`s newspaper readers and online community will be able to download the content directly to their mobile devices, such as cell phones and PDA`s, via a dedicated short code after browsing handpicked selections showcased in the print publications and the online site. "ImpreMedia is thrilled to be able to offer Televisa`s mobile content through this partnership with globefish." said Duran. "globefish`s experience in mobile content and services and proactive involvement in our overall mobile strategy will help us to guarantee an excellent customer experience." "We are delighted to play such a significant role in aligning two leading media companies in an effort to serve new products and solutions to the growing US Hispanic market, starting with mobile content from Televisa`s high profile catalogue," said Jennifer Koster, CEO of globefish. "ImpreMedia is the ideal partner to deliver Televisa`s mobile content, its unique relationship with millions of US Hispanics will provide all parties the ability to greatly increase their market reach, and allow globefish to extend the success of Televisa and Esmas from Latin America into the US." ABOUT GLOBEFISH globefish monetizes content and creates unique advertising and sponsorship opportunities for brands through its network of leading digital media channels and innovative applications. globefish takes an active role in identifying and executing business opportunities in digital and mobile as integrated components to traditional business models in media, entertainment, telecommunications and advertising. For its media clients, globefish enables diversification of revenue streams with solutions including mobile content, mobile advertising, and cross platform products that fully integrate web and mobile offerings with an approach designed to optimize reach and exposure. ABOUT TELEVISA Grupo Televisa S.A. (NYSE: TV, BMV: TLEVISA CPO) is the largest media company in the Spanish-speaking world, and a major player in the international entertainment business. It has interests in television production and broadcasting, programming for pay television, international distribution of television programming, direct-to-home satellite services, publishing and publishing distribution, cable television, radio production and broadcasting, professional sports and show business promotions, paging services, feature film production and distribution, dubbing, and the operation of a horizontal Internet portal. ABOUT IMPREMEDIA ImpreMedia is the No. 1 Hispanic News and Information Company in the U.S. in Online and Print. ImpreMedia`s multi-platform offerings range from Online to Video, Mobile and Print and encompass 28 properties, including the portal http://www.impre.com and its McClatchy partners. 35% of all U.S. Hispanic adults use an impreMedia product. The company is also the nation`s largest Hispanic newspaper publisher with newspapers in the top 7 U.S. Hispanic markets, reaching 17 markets total and representing 64% of the U.S. Hispanic population. Its leading publications include La Opinión in Los Angeles and El Diario La Prensa in New York. York. For more information, visit: http://www.impremedia.com. ImpreMedia portals and publications websites are: www.impre.com, www.imprerewards.com, www.lavibra.com, www.impreautos.com, www.laopinion.com, www.eldiariony.com, www.hoynyc.com, www.laraza.com, www.laprensafl.com, www.elmensajero.com, www.diariosrumbo.com, www.vistamagazine.com, and www.contigola.com. entry.headline: REG-Intnl Bus. Mach IBM Board Approves Regular Quarterly Cash Dividend
entry.body: ARMONK, N.Y.--(Business Wire)-- The IBM (NYSE: IBM) board of directors today declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.50 per common share, payable March 10, 2009 to stockholders of record February 10, 2009. With the payment of the March 10 dividend, IBM will have paid consecutive quarterly dividends every year since 1916. IBM also announced that its next annual meeting of stockholders will be held April 28, 2009 at the Miami Beach Convention Center, Miami Beach, Florida. IBM Douglas Shelton, 914/499-6533 doshelton@us.ibm.com IBM Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Mitel Announces Patent Cross License Agreement with IBM
entry.body: OTTAWA, ONTARIO, Jan 27 (MARKET WIRE) -- Mitel(R) today announced a patent cross license agreement with IBM. The cross license provides mutual access to a broad range of patents that will enable the companies to pursue strategic opportunities created by the transition to unified communications. "This agreement with IBM will enable our companies and our customers to benefit from the innovation and creativity that is embodied in our respective patents and inventions," said Christian Szpilfogel, head of Mitel's Intellectual Property Licensing. "We believe in taking a collaborative yet proactive approach to protecting our intellectual property." "IBM has a rich history of licensing intellectual property to encourage innovation and collaboration," said Dan Cerutti, general manager, IBM Intellectual Property Licensing. "Patent cross licenses provide a foundation for organizations to cooperate and better compete in the global economy." Specific terms of the agreement will not be disclosed. Mitel and IBM maintain active patent and technology licensing programs that offer licensing arrangements to companies interested in their respective portfolios. About Mitel Mitel delivers flexibility and simplicity in smart unified communications solutions and applications for organizations of all sizes. Combined with a full range of managed services that include voice and data network design and traffic provisioning, custom application development, and attractive financing options, Mitel is reinventing how successful organizations gain competitive advantage by easily collaborating and communicating over distance and time with customers, colleagues and partners. Mitel's (www.mitel.com) U.S. headquarters are in Phoenix, Arizona. Global headquarters are in Ottawa, Canada, with offices, partners, and resellers worldwide. Mitel and logo are registered trademarks of Mitel Networks Corporation. All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners. Contacts: Mitel Danielle McNeil (media) 613-592-2122 x 4643 danielle_mcneil@mitel.com Mitel Kevin Johnson (analysts) 613-592-2122 x 6690 kevin_johnson@mitel.com Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company to Receive 2009 World Environment Center Gold Medal for International Corporate Achievement in Sustainable Development
entry.body: WASHINGTON--(Business Wire)-- The World Environment Center`s (WEC) Twenty-Fifth Annual Gold Medal for International Corporate Achievement in Sustainable Development has been awarded to The Coca-Cola Company for implementing strategic business initiatives in the high impact areas of water stewardship, sustainable packaging, energy management and climate protection. Coca-Cola`s Signature Contribution, "returning to nature and communities an amount of water equal to what it uses in all of its beverages and their production", was cited by the independent international Gold Medal Jury as an exceptional demonstration of leadership in sustainability. Based on reducing and recycling the water used in manufacturing, and replenishing water as a vital resource, the efforts are yielding important social, environmental, and economic benefits. Muhtar Kent, President and Chief Executive Officer, The Coca-Cola Company said:"We are very pleased to be recognized with this important international award. Together with our bottling partners around the world, we have made a deep commitment to managing and preserving our water resources. This recognition from the World Environment Center gives us confidence that we are heading in the right direction." "It is a great honor for the jury to name The Coca-Cola Company as the 25th recipient of the prestigious Gold Medal Award. The company`s outstanding contributions in providing safe water for communities around the world set the standard for others to follow" said the Gold Medal Jury Chairman Dr. Joel Abrams, Professor Emeritus of the University of Pittsburgh. The WEC Gold Medal Award will be presented to The Coca-Cola Company at the 25th Gold Medal Presentation gala on Friday, May 8, 2009 at the National Building Museum in Washington, D.C. Mr. Kent will accept the award on behalf of the company and its employees. The World Environment Center Gold Medal for International Corporate Achievement in Sustainable Development was established in 1985 to recognize top industry initiatives in global environmental excellence and sustainable development. The WEC Gold Medal Jury is independent of the WEC and its programs, and is composed of international leaders from academia, government, and non-governmental organizations and retired industry professionals. About The Coca-Cola Company The Coca-Cola Company is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 450 sparkling and still brands. Along with Coca-Cola, recognized as the world's most valuable brand, the Company's portfolio includes 12 other billion dollar brands, including Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, POWERade, Minute Maid and Georgia Coffee. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, juices and juice drinks and ready-to-drink teas and coffees. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy the Company's beverages at a rate of 1.5 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that protect the environment, conserve resources and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. About World Environment Center The World Environment Center (WEC) is an independent, non-profit, non-advocacy organization whose mission is to advance sustainable development through the business practices of its member companies in partnership with government and other stakeholders. WEC's activities and operations are global in scope, and it is unique in providing direct, on-the-ground support to companies to improve their performance, and that of their business partners, across the value chain. Recent recipients of the WEC Gold Medal Award are: Marks & Spencer (2008), Alcan Inc (2007), ABN AMRO Bank (2006), Starbucks (2005), Johnson Controls Inc. (2004), Ricoh Group Ltd. (2003) and CEMEX (2002). WEC CONTACT: Iris Ovadiya, (+1 202) 312-1211 or COCA-COLA CONTACT: Lisa Manley, (+1 404) 676-2683 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: AtHoc to Exhibit Its Flagship Net-Centric Emergency Notification System at Microsoft Army Symposium
entry.body: SAN MATEO, CA, Jan 27 (MARKET WIRE) -- AtHoc, Inc., the pioneer and leader in network-centric emergency notification systems, today announced the company has become a four star sponsor for Microsoft's Army Symposium that is taking place February 9-13, 2009 in Redmond, Wa. The event provides a valuable forum for Microsoft and its partners to demonstrate technologies that can benefit Army programs throughout the world. AtHoc will demonstrate AtHoc IWSAlerts(TM) in its booth on the show floor. AtHoc provides the Department of Defense with mass notification solutions that unify multiple forms of alerting into a single solution. Through the AtHoc system, military facilities and entire commands can trigger alerts to computers, mobile devices, landline telephones, cell phones, sirens, public address systems, BlackBerry devices, digital displays, land mobile radios and any channel that can be triggered through an IP interface. The AtHoc solution is already used to protect more than one million military personnel in the Army, Navy, Air Force and Joint Forces. Within the Army alone, AtHoc IWSAlerts is used to protect Camp Slayer, Fort Riley, Fort Lee, Presidio of Monterey, Headquarters Garrison Vicenza (Italy), Headquarters U.S. Army Pacific (USARPAC), Rock Island Arsenal, and four Army Corps of Engineers' research and development centers across the country. "The Microsoft Army Symposium will allow us to connect with Army personnel and explain why major commands throughout the military have decided to standardize their network-centric emergency alerting with AtHoc," said Colonel David W. Brown (Ret.), director of U.S. Army operations for AtHoc. "Not only do we simplify multi-channel alerting, we provide the ability to reach hundreds of thousands of people in less than two minutes. We also make it possible for military facilities to track responses to alerts to determine if personnel are okay, hurt, trapped, etc. AtHoc IWSAlerts can help Army facilities better protect personnel and property in response to all types of threats." AtHoc is a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and builds its solutions on top of the Microsoft platform. About AtHoc AtHoc is the pioneer and recognized leader in providing enterprise-class, network-centric emergency notification systems to military, government and commercial organizations for physical security, force protection and personnel accountability. Millions of end users worldwide, in organizations such as the U.S. Air Force, U.S. Army, U.S. Navy, U.S. Patent and Trademark Office, NASA, Microsoft, Boeing and PricewaterhouseCoopers rely on AtHoc's unified management systems for their emergency alerting and critical communication needs. AtHoc has partnered with market leaders including Microsoft, Cisco, Dell, Harris, Siemens, Avaya, Lockheed Martin and others to bring these notification solutions to the public and commercial markets. For more information on AtHoc, please visit http://www.athoc.com. Contact: Ivy Eckerman Spire Communications (540) 373-2963 Email Contact Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: UPDATE 1-Goldman adds Bristol-Myers to conviction buy list
entry.body:
Jan 27 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs added Bristol-Myers Squibb Co (BMY.N) to America's conviction buy list, saying it believes the drugmaker was "aggressively pursuing" strategic options, including takeovers and spin-offs.

"Bristol-Myers continues to be active in mergers and acquisitions, enhancing its strategic attractiveness to an acquirer or as a break-up candidate," analyst Jami Rubin wrote in a research note.

"The majority of the company's cash is also generated in the United States, increasing both strategic value and flexibility," the analyst added.

Takeovers and spin-offs are now more likely given the blockbuster Pfizer-Wyeth deal announced on Monday, Rubin said.

Pfizer Inc's (PFE.N) proposed $68 billion acquisition of Wyeth WYE.N is expected to be the first in a string of strategic moves to restructure the pharmaceutical industry, Rubin wrote. Rubin has a $27 price target on Bristol-Myers stock.

Shares of the company were up 3 percent at $23 on low volumes before the bell. They closed at $22.25 Monday on the New York Stock Exchange. (Reporting by Esha Dey in Bangalore; Editing by Himani Sarkar)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: IBM cutting about 2,800 jobs, documents show
entry.body:
BOSTON (Reuters) - IBM (IBM.N), the world's biggest technology services company, is cutting about 2,800 jobs in North America, according to documents supplied by a union seeking to represent the company's employees.

International Business Machines Corp spokesman Doug Shelton confirmed on Monday that the company last week informed some employees that their positions were being eliminated. But he declined to say how many were being cut.

IBM's move came as companies in the United States and Europe announced tens of thousands of layoffs on Monday.

The job cuts at IBM were evenly split between its software division and its sales and distribution unit, according to Lee Conrad, national coordinator for the Alliance at IBM. His group is a local chapter of the Communications Workers of America that is seeking to represent IBM's employees.

Conrad added that he expects further layoffs to be announced, this time at IBM's hardware division.

Shelton declined to say which business divisions were cutting jobs. He added that the company regularly eliminates some jobs and adds new ones as business needs change.

The Armonk, New York-based company -- which is the world's No. 2 maker of software and biggest manufacturer of mainframe computers -- employed nearly 400,000 workers at the end of December, up from about 386,000 a year earlier.

"The nature of our business is such that we must constantly assess employee skills and resources, at any given time, to give IBM the flexibility to match the current and future needs of our clients," Shelton said.

"Managing talent in this way keeps IBM competitive, which we know is very important -- especially when the economy is in a downturn," he added.

Laid off workers were given 30 to 90 days notice, were encouraged to apply for other jobs within IBM, and will be granted severance packages upon leaving the company, Shelton said.

Workers will receive one week of pay for each six months of service with IBM, up to a maximum of 26 weeks of salary, according to one of the documents provided by Conrad.

Shelton declined to discuss details of the severance packages.

(Reporting by Jim Finkle; editing by Carol Bishopric)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs présente la première promotion en Inde des diplômées de l'Initiative 10.000 Femmes
entry.body: La participation accrue des femmes indiennes au sein de la population active pourrait augmenter les taux de croissance du PIB réel de 1 % ; le PIB par habitant pourrait augmenter jusqu'à 10 % HYDERABAD, Inde--(Business Wire)-- Le Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) s'est joint aujourd'hui à des étudiantes de l'Indian School of Business (ISB) pour célébrer la remise des diplômes à la première promotion des étudiantes de l'initiative 10.000 Femmes en Inde. 10.000 Femmes est une initiative mondiale qui permet à des femmes défavorisées, principalement dans les marchés des pays en développement et émergents, d'étudier les affaires et la gestion des entreprises. Les étudiantes recevant leur diplôme ont rencontré les dirigeants de Goldman Sachs et de l'ISB et ont présenté des plans d'affaires qu'elles ont développés tout au long de leur programme d'études et qu'elles destinent à l'élargissement de leurs entreprises existantes. Les 29 femmes de la première promotion de diplômées ont commencé leur programme d'études en octobre. Les diplômées ont achevé un programme de 150 heures leur donnant un certificat en entrepreneuriat avec trois semaines de cours en salle de classe et neuf semaines de mentorat et de soutien chez leur employeur. L'objectif final du programme d'études était d'aider les femmes à développer leurs entreprises en les faisant passer du statut de start-up à celui d'entreprises à la croissance durable. Un deuxième groupe de femmes commencera son programme d'études à Bangalore en février. Au total, 300 Indiennes recevront une formation dans le cadre de ce programme qui se déroule sur cinq années. « Ces diplômées de l'initiative10,000 Women illustrent brillamment le potentiel quasiment illimité de l'économie indienne », déclare Brooks Entwistle, directeur général et CEO de Goldman Sachs India. « Les études ont montré que les investissements réalisés dans de telles formes d'enseignement de la gestion des entreprises ont un effet multiplicateur spectaculaire et positif à la fois sur les économies locales et sur les niveaux de vie. » L'initiative 10.000 Femmes a son origine dans une étude dirigée par la Banque mondiale, Goldman Sachs et d'autres, qui a démontré que le fait de permettre aux femmes de faire des études est l'une des manières les plus efficaces de développer la croissance économique et d'améliorer les niveaux de vie dans les économies des pays en développement. La conclusion de ces recherches est que, en moyenne, une augmentation d'un point de pourcentage de l'enseignement féminin se traduit par une hausse annuelle des taux de croissance du PIB de 0,2 points de pourcentage. « Women Hold Up Half the Sky » (les femmes soutiennent la moitié du ciel), une analyse publiée par Goldman Sachs Economic Research, a montré que l'augmentation du nombre des femmes dans la population active, un cas de figure qui dérive naturellement du développement du système éducatif, pourrait ajouter un point de pourcentage au taux de croissance annuel du PIB de l'Inde et pourrait aboutir à une hausse de 10 % de son PIB par habitant en une décennie. Le programme d'études de l'ISB offre aux étudiantes un enseignement en salle de classe, un mentorat, des possibilités de travailler en réseau ainsi que des études de cas portant sur des entreprises du monde entier qui ont réussi. Dans la phase finale du programme, les étudiantes se sont mesurées lors d'une présentation de plans d'affaires qu'elles ont mis au point dans le but de développer leurs propres entreprises existantes. L'initiative de Goldman Sachs 10.000 Femmes a été lancée le 5 mars 2008. Elle engagera 100 millions de dollars au cours des cinq prochaines années et elle est associée à plus de 50 universités et organisations en Afrique, en Asie, en Europe, en Amérique latine, au Moyen-Orient et aux États-Unis dans le but de rechercher, de créer et de mettre au point des programmes visant à influencer la qualité et les capacités de l'enseignement de la gestion des entreprises dans les régions en développement du monde entier. Pour de plus amples informations sur le programme 10.000 Femmes, veuillez consulter le site www.10000women.org. Le Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. est une holding bancaire et une société de premier plan mondial en tant que banque d'investissement, société de gestion de portefeuille et société de gestion de placements. Goldman Sachs offre une vaste gamme de services dans le monde entier à une base clients importante et diversifiée qui comprend des grandes sociétés, des institutions financières, des gouvernements ainsi que des clients patrimoniaux. Fondée en 1869, la société a son siège social à New York et est implantée à Londres, à Francfort, à Tokyo, à Hong Kong et dans d'autres centres financiers majeurs répartis dans le monde entier. Le texte du communiqué issu d`une traduction ne doit d`aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d`origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence. The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. entry.headline: Goldman Sachs kondigt eerste lichting afgestudeerden uit India aan uit het programma 10,000 Women
entry.body: Groter aandeel aan vrouwen in Indiaas arbeidspotentieel kan leiden tot groei van het BNP met 1,0%; BNP per hoofd van de bevolking zou 10% kunnen stijgen HYDERABAD, India--(Business Wire)-- De Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) heeft zich vandaag bij de studenten van de Indian School of Business (ISB) gevoegd om stil te staan bij het afstuderen van de eerste lichting studenten die hebben deelgenomen aan het initiatief 10,000 Women in India. 10,000 Women is een internationaal programma om minder bevoorrechte vrouwen, met name in markten die in ontwikkeling en in opkomst zijn, een zakelijke of bestuurlijke opleiding te bieden. De afgestudeerde studenten hadden een ontmoeting met de leiding van Goldman Sachs, ISB, en presenteerden de bedrijfsplannen die ze als onderdeel van de cursus hadden ontwikkeld en die bedoeld zijn om hun bestaande zakelijke activiteiten uit te breiden. De eerste lichting van 29 vrouwen begon in oktober aan de cursus De afgestudeerden voltooiden een certificaatopleiding van 150 uur in ondernemerschap, inclusief drie weken instructie in klasvorm en negen weken begeleiding en ondersteuning in de praktijk. Het uiteindelijke doel van de cursus was de vrouwen te helpen bij het laten uitgroeien van hun bedrijf van een startende onderneming naar een groeiende en stabiele onderneming. In februari begint een tweede groep vrouwen aan de cursus in Bangalore. In de loop van het vijfjarige programma zullen in totaal 300 Indiase vrouwen de opleiding kunnen volgen. "Deze afgestudeerden van het programma 10,000 Women vormen een schitterend voorbeeld van de nagenoeg onbegrensde mogelijkheden van de Indiase economie," aldus Brooks Entwistle, Managing Director en Chief Executive Officer van Goldman Sachs India. "Onderzoek heeft uitgewezen dat investeringen een zakelijke opleidingen zoals deze een dramatisch en positief vermenigvuldigingseffect kunnen hebben op zowel de plaatselijke economie als de levensstandaard." Het initiatief 10,000 Women is gebaseerd op onderzoek uitgevoerd door de Wereldbank, Goldman Sachs, en anderen, waaruit bleek dat het opleiden van vrouwen een van de meest effectieve manieren is om de economische groei te bevorderen en de levensstandaard in economieën in ontwikkeling te verbeteren. De conclusie van de studies is dat een toename van 1 procent in de scholing van vrouwen de jaarlijkse groei van het BNP gemiddeld met 0,2 procent verhoogt. "Women Hold Up Half the Sky," een analyse gepubliceerd door Goldman Sachs Economic Research, concludeert dat een groter aantal vrouwen in het arbeidspotentieel, een natuurlijk gevolg van meer scholing, de jaarlijkse groei van het BNP in India met 1% zou kunnen verhogen en het BNP per hoofd van de bevolking in tien jaar met 10% zou kunnen laten stijgen. Het curriculum van het ISB-programma biedt studenten instructie in een klaslokaal, begeleiding, contacten en case studies van succesvolle bedrijven wereldwijd. In de laatste fase van het programma presenteren de studenten een bedrijfsplan dat ze hebben opgezet om hun bestaande onderneming uit te breiden. Het initiatief 10,000 Women van Goldman Sachs ging op 5 maart 2008 van start. In het kader van het programma wordt verspreid over de komende vijf jaar US$ 100 miljoen besteed, en wordt samengewerkt met meer dan 50 universiteiten en organisaties in Afrika, Azië, Europa, Latijns-Amerika, het Midden-Oosten en de Verenigde Staten voor het vinden, opzetten en ontwikkelen van programma`s om de kwaliteit en capaciteit van zakelijk onderwijs in ontwikkelingsregio`s wereldwijd te bevorderen. Voor meer informatie over het programma 10,000 Women kunt u terecht op www.10000women.org. De Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is een bankiersholding en een wereldomspannende investeringsbank en beheerder van effecten en beleggingen. Goldman Sachs biedt wereldwijd een breed assortiment aan diensten aan een aanzienlijke en gevarieerd klantenbestand, dat bestaat uit bedrijven, financiële instellingen, overheden en vermogende individuen. Het bedrijf is opgericht in 1869 en heeft haar hoofdkantoor in New York. Verder beschikt het bedrijf over kantoren in Londen, Frankfurt, Tokio, Hongkong en andere belangrijke financiële centra, verspreid over de hele wereld. Deze bekendmaking is officieel geldend in de originele brontaal. Vertalingen zijn slechts als leeshulp bedoeld en moeten worden vergeleken met de tekst in de brontaal welke als enige juridische geldigheid beoogt. The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs anuncia la graduación de las primeras 10.000 mujeres de India
entry.body: La mayor participación de mujeres en la población activa de India podría aumentar las tasas de crecimiento del PBI real en un 1,0%; el PBI per cápita podría aumentar hasta en un 10% HYDERABAD, India--(Business Wire)-- El Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) se reunió hoy con estudiantes de la Indian School of Business (escuela de negocios hindú, ISB) para marcar la graduación de las primeras estudiantes de la iniciativa 10.000 mujeres en India. La iniciativa 10.000 mujereses un esfuerzo mundial que ofrece a mujeres inmerecidas, predominantemente en los mercados en desarrollo y emergentes, educación en el área de negocios y de administración. Las estudiantes graduadas se reunieron con líderes de Goldman Sachs e ISB, y presentaron planes de negocios a través de sus trabajos en el curso e intentaron expandir sus negocios existentes. La primera clase de 29 mujeres graduadas comenzó su trabajo en el curso en octubre. Las graduadas finalizaron un programa de certificado en capacidad empresarial con una duración de 150 horas que incluyó tres semanas de instrucción en clase y nueve semanas apoyo de mentores y en el trabajo. La meta final del trabajo en el curso fue la de ayudar a que las mujeres expandan sus empresas desde el comienzo hasta convertirse en empresas en crecimiento y sostenibles. Un segundo grupo de mujeres comenzará sus estudios en Bangalore en febrero. Un total de 300 mujeres hindúes recibirán capacitación durante el programa de cinco años. "Estas graduadas de la iniciativa 10.000 mujeres son un ejemplo brillante del potencial infinito de la economía hindú", expresó Brooks Entwistle, Director Principal y Director Ejecutivo de Goldman Sachs India. "La investigación ha demostrado que las inversiones realizadas en la educación de los negocios, como éstas, pueden tener efectos multiplicados espectaculares y positivos tanto sobre las economías locales como sobre los estándares de vida". La iniciativa 10.000 mujeressebasó en la investigación realizada por el Banco Mundial, Goldman Sachs y otros, que descubrió que educar a las mujeres es una de las formas más eficientes de aumentar el crecimiento de la economía y de mejorar los estándares de vida en las economías en desarrollo. Los estudios concluyen que, en promedio, un aumento de un uno por ciento en la educación femenina aumenta la tasa de crecimiento del PBI en un 0,2 por ciento. "Women Hold Up Half the Sky" (las mujeres sostienen medio cielo), un análisis publicado por Goldman Sachs Economic Research, descubrió que aumentando la cantidad de mujeres en la población activa -que es una consecuencia natural de mayor educación- podría agregar un 1% a las tasas de crecimiento del PBI anual de India y podría aumentar su PBI per cápita en un 10% en una década. El currículo del programa de la ISB ofrece a los estudiantes la instrucción en clase, el apoyo de mentores, redes y estudios de caso de firmas exitosas de todo el mundo. En la fase final del programa, las estudiantes competieron en una presentación de los planes de negocios diseñados para expandir sus propios negocios existentes. La iniciativa 10.000 mujeres de Goldman Sachs fue lanzada el 5 de marzo de 2008. Asignará USD$100 millones en los próximos cinco años y se ha asociado con más de 50 universidades y organizaciones de África, Asia, Europa, América Latina, el Oriente Medio y los Estados Unidos para buscar, crear y desarrollar programas que produzcan un impacto en la calidad y la capacidad de la educación de negocios en las regiones en desarrollo de todo el mundo. Para obtener más información acerca del programa 10.000 mujeres por favor, visite www.10000women.org. El Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. es una empresa de control bancaria y una firma de gestión de inversiones, títulos valores e inversiones bancarias líder a nivel mundial. Goldman Sachs ofrece una amplia gama de servicios en todo el mundo a una base de clientes sustanciales y diversificados que incluye corporaciones, instituciones financieras, gobiernos y una gran red de personas. La firma, fundada en 1869, tiene la sede central en Nueva York y cuenta con oficinas en Londres, Fráncfort, Tokio, Hong Kong y otros centros financieros importantes en todo el mundo. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs annuncia le prime diplomate indiane dell'iniziativa 10.000 Women
entry.body: La maggiore partecipazione da parte delle donne nella popolazione attiva indiana potrebbe far aumentare il PIL reale secondo tassi di crescita dell'1,0%; il PIL pro capite potrebbe aumentare fino al 10% HYDERABAD, India--(Business Wire)-- The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) si è unito oggi con gli studenti della Indian School of Business (ISB) per caratterizzare il diploma delle prime studentesse della iniziativa 10.000 Women in India. 10.000 Women è un'opera globale per offrire alle donne provenienti da aree sotto-servite, in prevalenza dei mercati emergenti e in via di sviluppo, formazione nel settore della gestione ed amministrazione degli affari. Le studentesse diplomande hanno incontrato i leader di Goldman Sachs e della ISB, e hanno presentato i piani di attività (business plan) sviluppati durante i loro studi e progettati per espandere le loro attività già esistenti. Il primo corso costituito da 29 donne era iniziato ad ottobre. Le studentesse hanno completato un programma di 150 ore per l'imprenditorialità che ha incluso tre settimane di lezioni in classe e nove settimane di tutoraggio e supporto sul luogo di lavoro. L'obiettivo finale del corso è stato quello di aiutare le donne ad espandere le loro attività facendole passare dalle fasi iniziali, fino a diventare imprese crescenti e sostenibili. Un secondo gruppo di donne inizierà gli studi a Bangalore nel mese di febbraio. Un totale di 300 donne indiane riceverà formazione durante un programma di cinque anni. "Queste diplomate dell'iniziativa 10,000 Women sono un brillante esempio del potenziale quasi infinito dell'economia indiana", ha detto Brooks Entwistle, amministratore delegato e direttore generale di Goldman Sachs India. "La ricerca ha mostrato che investimenti come questi, effettuati nell'istruzione imprenditoriale, possono avere un notevole effetto moltiplicatore e positivo sia sulle economie locali che sugli standard di vita". L'iniziativa 10.000 Women è stata finanziata dalla ricerca condotta da parte della Banca Mondiale, di Goldman Sachs, e di altre istituzioni che hanno scoperto che l'educazione delle donne è uno dei modi più efficaci per aumentare la crescita economica e migliorare i livelli di vita per le economie in via di sviluppo. Gli studi effettuati hanno concluso che, in media, l'aumento di un punto percentuale nell'educazione femminile aumenta la crescita del PIL annuale dello 0,2 percento. "Le donne sostengono metà del cielo", ha intitolato un analista del gruppo per la ricerca sull'economia di Goldman Sachs, scoprendo che un aumento nel numero delle donne nella forza lavoro, che è una conseguenza naturale di una maggiore istruzione, potrebbe aumentare dell'1% i livelli di crescita annuale del PIL dell'India e potrebbe aumentare il suo PIL pro capite del 10% in una decade. Il programma del corso di studi della ISB offre agli studenti fasi di formazione in classe, tutoraggio, formazione professionale esterna (networking) e studio di casi specifici relativi ad imprese di successo in tutto il mondo. Nella fase finale del programma, le studentesse hanno gareggiato nella presentazione di un "business plan" progettato da loro per espandere la loro stessa attività imprenditoriale già esistente. L'iniziativa di Goldman Sachs 10.000 Women è stata lanciata il 5 marzo 2008. Impegnerà $100 milioni di dollari americani nei prossimi cinque anni ed è associata con più di 50 università ed organizzazioni in Africa, Asia, Europa, America Latina, Medio Oriente e negli Stati Uniti per cercare, creare e sviluppare programmi che incidano sulla qualità e la capacità della formazione imprenditoriale nella valorizzazione di nuove regioni in tutto il mondo. Per ulteriori informazioni sul programma 10.000 Women, vi preghiamo di visitare il sito www.10000women.org. Il Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. è una finanziaria bancaria, un'importante banca globale d'investimento, e impresa di gestione degli investimenti e dei titoli. Goldman Sachs fornisce un'ampia gamma di servizi in tutto il mondo per una base di clienti solida e diversificata che include grandi società, istituti finanziarie, governi e privati che possiedono un alto patrimonio netto. Fondata nel 1869, l'impresa ha la sua sede centrale a New York ed ha filiali a Londra, Francoforte, Tokyo, Hong Kong ed in altri importanti centri finanziari in tutto il mondo. Il testo originale del presente annuncio, redatto nella lingua di partenza, è la versione ufficiale che fa fede. Le traduzioni sono offerte unicamente per comodità del lettore e devono rinviare al testo in lingua originale, che è l'unico giuridicamente valido. The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs Announces India`s First Graduates of 10,000 Women
entry.body: Greater Participation by Women in Indian Labor Force Could Increase Real GDP Growth Rates By 1.0%; GDP per Capita Could Increase By Up To 10% HYDERABAD, India--(Business Wire)-- The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) today joined with students at the Indian School of Business (ISB) to mark the graduation of the first students in the 10,000 Women initiative in India. 10,000 Women is a global effort providing underserved women, predominantly in developing and emerging markets, with business and management education. Graduating students met with leaders from Goldman Sachs, ISB, and presented business plans developed through their coursework and intended to expand their existing businesses. The first graduating class of 29 women began their course work in October. Graduates completed a 150-hour certificate program in entrepreneurship that included three weeks of classroom instruction and nine weeks of mentoring and on-the-job support. The end goal of the coursework was to help the women expand their businesses from start-ups to growing and sustainable enterprises. A second group of women will begin their studies in Bangalore in February. A total of 300 Indian women will receive training over the five-year program. "These graduates of 10,000 Women are a shining example of the near limitless potential of the Indian economy," said Brooks Entwistle, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of Goldman Sachs India. "Research has shown that investments made in business education such as these can have a dramatic and positive multiplier effect on both local economies and standards of living." The 10,000 Women initiativewas founded on research conducted by the World Bank, Goldman Sachs, and others, which found that educating women is one of the most effective ways to increase economic growth and improve living standards in developing economies. Studies conclude that, on average, a one percentage point increase in female education raises annual GDP growth rates by 0.2 percentage point. "Women Hold Up Half the Sky," an analysis published by Goldman Sachs Economic Research, found that increasing the number of women in the labor force, which is a natural outcome of more education, could add 1% to India`s annual GDP growth rates and could raise its GDP per capita by 10% in a decade. The ISB program curriculum offers students classroom instruction, mentoring, networking, and case studies of successful firms from around the globe. In the final phase of the program, students competed in a presentation of business plans they designed to expand their own existing businesses. The Goldman Sachs 10,000 Women initiative was launched March 5, 2008. It will commit US$100 million over the next five years and has partnered with more than 50 universities and organizations in Africa, Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and United States to seek, create and develop programs to impact the quality and capacity of business education in developing regions around the world. For further information on the 10,000 Women program, please visit www.10000women.org. The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a bank holding company and a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Goldman Sachs provides a wide range of services worldwide to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and high net worth individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in London, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Hong Kong and other major financial centers around the world. The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs stellt die ersten indischen Absolventinnen der 10,000 Women-Initiative vor
entry.body: Eine größere Beteiligung von Frauen am indischen Arbeitsmarkt könnte das Wachstum des realen Bruttosozialproduktes des Landes um 1 Prozent, sein Bruttosozialprodukt pro Einwohner um bis zu 10 Prozent steigern. HYDERABAD, Indien--(Business Wire)-- Die Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (NYSE: GS) kam heute mit Studentinnen der Indian School of Business (ISB) zusammen, um die Graduierung der ersten Teilnehmerinnen der 10,000 Women-Initiative in Indien zu feiern.10,000 Women ist eine globale Kampagne, die darauf abzielt, unterprivilegierten Frauen in erster Linie aus Entwicklungs- und Schwellenländern in Betriebswirtschaft und Unternehmensführung auszubilden. Die Absolventinnen trafen Führungskräfte von Goldman Sachs und ISB und präsentierten Geschäftspläne zur Ausweitung ihrer bestehenden Unternehmen, die sie im Rahmen ihrer Studien entwickelt hatten. Die erste Abgangsklasse besteht aus 29 Frauen, die ihr Studium im Oktober letzten Jahres begannen. Die Absolventinnen schlossen ein 150-stündiges Zertifizierungsprogramm ab, das drei Wochen von Klassenunterricht und neun Wochen von praktischer Betreuung und berufsbegleitender Unterstützung umfasste. Das Endziel des Studiums war, den Frauen zu helfen, ihre Geschäfte über die Gründungsphase hinaus in wachsende und nachhaltige Unternehmen auszubauen. Im Februar wird eine zweite Gruppe von Frauen ihr Studium in Bangalore beginnen. Das Fünf-Jahres-Programm wird insgesamt 300 indischen Frauen eine Ausbildung vermitteln. „Diese Absolventinnen der 10,000 Women-Initiative sind ein leuchtendes Beispiel für das nahezu grenzenlose Potenzial der indischen Wirtschaft", sagte Brooks Entwistle, der Geschäftsführer und CEO von Goldman Sachs India. „Studien belegen, dass Investitionen in die unternehmerische Ausbildung wie diese einen dramatischen und positiven Multiplikationseffekt auf die örtliche Wirtschaft wie auch den Lebensstandard haben können." Die 10,000 Women -Initiative beruht auf von der World Bank, Goldman Sachs und anderen durchgeführten Studien, die fanden, dass die Ausbildung von Frauen eine der wirkungsvollsten Möglichkeiten zur Förderung des Wirtschaftswachstums und der Lebensbedingungen in Entwicklungsländern ist. Diese Studien ergaben, dass eine durchschnittliche Steigerung der Ausbildung von Frauen und Mädchen um einen Prozentpunkt das jährliche Wachstum des Bruttosozialproduktes um 0,2 Prozentpunkte steigert. Die von Goldman Sachs Economic Research veröffentlichte Analyse mit dem englischen Originaltitel „Women Hold Up Half the Sky" (zu Deutsch: „Frauen stützen den halben Himmel") stellte fest, dass ein erhöhter Anteil von Frauen am Arbeitsmarkt - eine natürliche Folge von mehr Bildung - das jährliche Wachstum von Indiens Bruttosozialprodukt um 1 Prozent steigern und sein Bruttosozialprodukt pro Einwohner innerhalb eines Jahrzehntes um 10 Prozent erhöhen könnte. Der Lehrplan der ISB bietet Studentinnen des Programms Klassenunterricht, berufsbegleitende Betreuung, Kontakte und Fallstudien erfolgreicher Firmen aus aller Welt. In der Endphase bereiteten die Studentinnen eine Präsentation von Geschäftsplänen zur Erweiterung ihrer bestehenden Unternehmen vor. Die 10,000 Women-Initiative von Goldman Sachs wurde am 5. März 2008 ins Leben gerufen. Sie wird über die nächsten fünf Jahre 100 Mio. US-Dollar bereitstellen und arbeitet mit über 50 Universitäten und Organisationen in Afrika, Asien, Europa Lateinamerika, Nahost und den USA zusammen, um Programme zu finden, zu entwickeln und zu schaffen, welche die Qualität und Kapazität betriebswirtschaftlicher Ausbildungsprogramme in Entwicklungsregionen in aller Welt verbessern. Weitere Informationen über das 10,000 Women-Programm finden Sie unter www.10000women.org. Die Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. ist eine Bankholdinggesellschaft und ein führendes globales Unternehmen, das in den Bereichen Investment-Banking, Wertpapier- und Anlagenverwaltung tätig ist. Goldman Sachs leistet ein breites Spektrum von Dienstleistungen in aller Welt für eine umfangreiche und vielfältige Kundenbasis, zu der Konzerne, Finanzinstitute, Regierungen und private Großanleger gehören. Das im Jahr 1869 gegründete Unternehmen ist in New York ansässig und unterhält Niederlassungen in London, Frankfurt, Tokio, Hongkong and anderen Finanzmetropolen rund um die Welt. Die Ausgangssprache, in der der Originaltext veröffentlicht wird, ist die offizielle und autorisierte Version. Übersetzungen werden zur besseren Verständigung mitgeliefert. Nur die Sprachversion, die im Original veröffentlicht wurde, ist rechtsgültig. Gleichen Sie deshalb Übersetzungen mit der originalen Sprachversion der Veröffentlichung ab. Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. entry.headline: General Electric Suffers 44% Drop in Net Earnings for Fiscal Year 2008, an Industrial Info News Alert
entry.body: SUGAR LAND, TX, Jan 27 (MARKET WIRE) -- Researched by Industrial Info Resources (Sugar Land, Texas) -- General Electric Company (NYSE:GE) (Fairfield, Connecticut) has announced that its net earnings for 2008 were down 44% to $3.72 billion, compared with $6.7 billion in 2007. The company faced substantial declines in its Capital Finance and Consumer & Industrial segments, while the Energy Infrastructure segment grew 26%. Industrial Info is tracking more than $1 billion of projects directly owned by GE or its subsidiaries. Information on these projects can be found at Industrial Info's North American Industrial Database. entry.headline: Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: Onyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Pfizer, Wyeth, Energizer Holdings, Inc. and Newfield Exploration.
entry.body: CHICAGO--(Business Wire)-- Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog include: Onyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: ONXX), Pfizer (NYSE: PFE), Wyeth (NYSE: WYE), Energizer Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: ENR)and Newfield Exploration (NYSE: NFX). Get the most recent insight from Zacks Equity Research with the free Profit from the Pros newsletter: http://at.zacks.com/?id=4579 Here are highlights from Monday`s Analyst Blog: Onyx Pharma's Nexavar Gleaming Onyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: ONXX) is engaged in the development of novel cancer therapies that target the molecular basis of cancer. With its collaborator Bayer Healthcare, the company develops the small molecule drug Nexavar (sorafenib). Nexavar sales in the third quarter of 2008 remained strong. This is mainly attributed to the market penetration in the liver cancer market, while Nexavar market share in kidney cancer market has stabilized due to heavy competition from Pfizer (NYSE: PFE) and Wyeth (NYSE: WYE). Energizer with Big Upside Energizer Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: ENR) has generated top-line growth both through organic growth in the razor blade and battery businesses and though the acquisition of Playtex and Hawaiian Tropic. In addition, integration savings, originally estimated to be $57 million, was increased to $70 million. Management is incentivized with annual and two-year bonus plans and a stock incentive plan. Historically, management has been successful in qualifying for performance-based awards. Newfield E from Buy to Sell Newfield Exploration (NYSE: NFX), based in Houston, Texas, is an independent energy company engaged in the exploration and production (E) of crude oil and natural gas. In an asset-diversification strategy, management has turned what was once an exclusive concentration in the Gulf of Mexico into a balanced portfolio. We are downgrading Newfield shares to Sell from Buy to reflect the company's weak competitive position in the current unfavorable macro backdrop. We believe that the Newfield asset portfolio centered around the Rockies and Gulf Coast regions are lacking in a meaningful exposure to the emerging shale plays. Want more from Zacks Equity Research? entry.headline: Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: AMB Property Corp., Charlotte Russe Holdings, Inc., Arch Coal, Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corporation and Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company S.A.
entry.body: CHICAGO--(Business Wire)-- Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog include: AMB Property Corp. (NYSE: AMB), Charlotte Russe Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHIC), Arch Coal (NYSE: ACI), Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corporation (NYSE: BNI)and Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company S.A. (NYSE: CCH). Get the most recent insight from Zacks Equity Research with the free Profit from the Pros newsletter: http://at.zacks.com/?id=4579 Here are highlights from Monday`s Analyst Blog: AMB Ppy Announces Impairments AMB Property Corp. (NYSE: AMB) today announced large impairment charges on its in-process development pipeline and land holdings. The company will take a $0.96 per share charge in 4Q08 to write down the value of in process developments and a $0.94 per share impairment on land holdings. In addition, the company will lay off about 22% of its global workforce. AMB depends on merchant building sales to third parties or funds which have historically made up a large part of the company's earnings. Cap-rate increases have decreased the value of the company's current development pipeline. Charlotte Russe Ests Lowered Charlotte Russe Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHIC) is a mall-based specialty apparel retailer, which carries both branded and private-label merchandise, targeting women in their teens and twenties. The retailer offers a broad assortment of fashionable merchandise. The company reported weaker-than-expected results for its fiscal first quarter, and CHIC's second quarter EPS guidance was below the market's expectations. We are lowering our estimates for fiscal 2009 and 2010. The company also announced that it was exploring strategic alternatives including selling the company. Arch Coal Rating Downed to Hold We are downgrading our recommendation on Arch Coal (NYSE: ACI) to Hold from Buy before the company releases its 4Q and full-year '08 results. Although coal prices have outperformed other commodities like steel, copper and oil, there looks to be no upside catalyst in the next six months for the industry and a result, ACI will likely trade flat during 1H'09. As the effects of global monetary and fiscal stimulatory efforts work their way into Wall Street and Main Street, it will be more apparent as to the direction of the global economy. However, we do anticipate emerging markets to start recovering late in '09, which would spur new demand for electricity and steel, driving coal stocks higher. Burlington Northern Balances Out We are continuing our Hold on Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corporation (NYSE: BNI), but decreasing our target price to $66. BNI reported 2008 fourth quarter diluted EPS of $1.79, up 23% year over year and above consensus of $1.74 and our $1.75 estimate, as expenses, primarily for fuel, were lower than estimated. Revenues were also below expectations, reflecting a 5% decline in volume that accelerated in the second half of the fourth quarter due to the global economic slowdown. We are sharply reducing our 2009 diluted EPS estimate to $5.05 from $6.90. CCH a Play on Eastern Europe Headquartered in Athens, Greece, Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company S.A. (NYSE: CCH) produces, markets, and distributes primarily products of The Coca-Cola Company in 28 countries, including Greece, Italy, Austria, Russia, Ukraine, Poland and Hungary, to name but a few. Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company enjoys an attractive geographic mix with 66% of revenues being derived from developing or emerging markets. In addition, the company's product mix is less dependent on CSDs (carbonated soft drinks) than other bottlers. Want more from Zacks Equity Research? entry.author: None
entry.headline: Retail investors buy into oil - Goldman Sachs
entry.body:
LONDON Jan 27 (Reuters) - Retail investors have begun to pile into oil attracted by its low price and are investing via exchange-traded funds (ETFs), which have seen unprecedented inflows, U.S. bank Goldman Sachs (GS.N) said on Tuesday.

Investor positions or "length" in the oil market has climbed back towards levels seen last summer, when prices were headed towards a record peak of more than $147 a barrel.

"However, over this time period, we have seen a shift in the type of investor interest," Goldman Sachs said in its latest Energy Weekly.

"The most recent surge in investor interest in oil has been mostly concentrated in ETF instruments," it said. "We believe that this has come mostly from the retail and private banking sectors."

Exchange traded funds are securities which track the value of an underlying instrument such as gold or oil futures.

Goldman said these investors tended to focus on the price level of oil, which contrasts with institutional investors, which focus more on the shape of oil's forward price curve.

Goldman estimated the number of oil barrels owned by investors is only down 13 percent since the oil market peaked in July.

"We estimate index investors now own 837 million barrels of oil versus 1,032 million barrels when oil prices peaked."

Oil has dropped more than $100 from its record high in July last year, depressed by sharp falls in demand as global economic growth has been hit by the fallout from the credit crisis.

Investor interest in oil and other commodities as an asset class surged over the past few years, with commodities seen as offering portfolio diversification versus equities and bonds.

The bulk of these institutional investors have tended to access the oil market via commodity indexes created from baskets of commodities.

Goldman said inflows into ETFs had contributed to oil's rally this month from lows near $30 a barrel towards $50 a barrel.

But the U.S. bank does not believe oil's bear market is over yet, pointing to a massive counter-seasonal stock build in the top energy consumer the United States and extremely weak demand from China, the world's second biggest energy user.

"We see this recent rally as being transient," the bank said. "We believe that this recent surge of investor length in the oil market is premature and would prefer to remain short oil until inventories stop building and demand weakness subsides." (Reporting by Jane Merriman; editing by James Jukwey)

entry.headline: JPT Launches 'PepTrack(tm) -- Peptide Library Technologies' for T-cell Assays in...
entry.body: JPT Launches 'PepTrack(tm) -- Peptide Library Technologies' for T-cell Assays in Vaccine Development BERLIN, Jan. 27, 2009 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- JPT Peptide Technologies GmbH (JPT), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Jerini AG (Frankfurt:JI4), announced today the launch of its new product line: PepTrack(tm). Designed for peptides in T-cell assays (ELISPOT, CFC, ICS and others), this approach represents the most efficient technique for producing large numbers of peptides simultaneously. In addition, PepTrack(tm) production is in compliance with DIN ISO 9001:2008 and Good Clinical Laboratory Practices. JPT offers four delivery options for T-cell assays: 1) Fast Track for proteome-wide T-cell epitope discovery programs 2) Research Track for T-cell epitope mapping studies 3) Discovery Track for immune monitoring applications and 4) Trial Track for vaccination trials. The new product line combines JPT's proprietary technologies with its in-depth knowledge of T-cell assays in discovery research and clinical trials. "Our clients' experience has shown that peptides with inappropriate specifications can, potentially, not only jeopardize T-cell assay performance, but also entire clinical studies," states Holger Wenschuh, Managing Director at JPT. "Avoiding sources of false positive T-cell response, eliminating toxic contaminants that inhibit T-cell activation, and developing and validating reproducible production processes have been the key drivers in the development of this new product line." As a worldwide leader in peptide research and production, JPT has now increased its production capacity to more than 2 million peptides per year. About JPT Peptide Technologies GmbH JPT Peptide Technologies GmbH is a leading provider of peptide-based research tools for applications focusing on cellular and humoral immune response monitoring, vaccine development, peptide biomarker discovery, and enzyme profiling. Using its patented high-throughput synthesis and screening platform, SPOT(tm), its peptide microarray technology, PepStar(tm), PepMix(tm), a new approach for antigen specific T-cell stimulation, and PepTrack(tm), a novel approach to create peptide libraries for specific use in T-cell assays, JPT has developed a series of innovative products and services to facilitate the development of novel immunotherapies and immune-monitoring tools. JPT's ability to produce highly complex peptide libraries coupled with its peptide array technology enables, for the first time, the discovery and profiling of B- and T-cell epitopes on a proteome-wide level. In addition, this capability facilitates the development of tools to monitor the immune status of diverse patient populations suffering from infectious and autoimmune diseases, allergies, and cancer. JPT is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Berlin-based Jerini AG. http://hugin.info/135931/R/1284929/287976.pdf -0- CONTACT: JPT Peptide Technologies GmbH Dr. Holger Wenschuh, Managing Director +49 - 30 - 6392 7880 Fax: +49 - 30 - 6392 5501 wenschuh@jpt.com www.jpt.com Volmerstr. 5 12555 Berlin/Germany
